page.title: 11BERKELEY POWER STATION (3)
page.content: Perhaps due to the constant watchful eye of{conservation}movements Berkeley Power Station moniters various local levels of{radiation}on for example the soil, water (esp. River Severn) and air. Two people are employed for this work, they visit local farms, streams, etc. and process their samples at laboratories based in nearby Stone. The conservation movements too, carry out periodic{inspections}to check the station's data. The CEGB's main nuclear research labs are also at Berkeley and are likely to{outlive}the power station. To add to the{conflict, the power station and the labs provide most of the local work so making the issue of{jobs vs dangers of nuclear {power}a difficult one to solve locally. Open Days and guided tours are used to try to promote the station as being part of a{'safe'}industry.
